CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Among PSCs fabricated , the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based device with an active blend layer spin - coated at 80 °C , showed the best photovoltaic performance with the highest PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% .

Let's think step by step.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Among PSCs fabricated , the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based device with an active blend layer spin - coated at 80 °C , showed the best photovoltaic performance with the highest PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% .

Let's think step by step.

1. PSCs: This is an abbreviation for "perovskite solar cells," which is a type of solar cell technology.
2. PffBB-14:PC71BM: This appears to be a specific type of material or blend used in the fabrication of the perovskite solar cells.
3. 80 °C: This is a temperature value, but in this context, it is referring to the temperature at which the active blend layer was spin-coated.
4. PCE: This stands for "power conversion efficiency," which is a measure of the efficiency of a solar cell in converting sunlight into electricity.
5. Voc: This stands for "open-circuit voltage," which is a measure of the maximum voltage that can be produced by a solar cell.
6. Jsc: This stands for "short-circuit current density," which is a measure of the maximum current that can be produced by a solar cell.
7. FF: This stands for "fill factor," which is a measure of the quality of a solar cell's power conversion efficiency.

Therefore, the "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are:

* PSCs
* PffBB-14:PC71BM
* 80 °C
* PCE
* Voc
* Jsc
* FF
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-14:PC71BM |
| PCE |
| Voc |
| Jsc |
| FF |

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Among PSCs fabricated , the PffBB-14:PC71BM - based device with an active blend layer spin - coated at 80 °C , showed the best photovoltaic performance with the highest PCE of 9.93% , a large V oc of 0.92 V , a highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 64.36% .

Let's think step by step.

1. "PCE of 9.93%" - Here, PCE refers to Power Conversion Efficiency, and it is a measurement of the efficiency of a solar cell. The "9.93%" is the value of the PCE.
2. "a large V oc of 0.92 V" - Here, Voc refers to Open-Circuit Voltage, and it is a measure of the maximum voltage that can be produced by a solar cell. The "0.92 V" is the value of the Voc.
3. "a highest J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2" - Here, Jsc refers to Short-Circuit Current Density, and it is a measure of the maximum current that can be produced by a solar cell. The "16.77 mA cm^-2" is the value of the Jsc.
4. "a FF of 64.36%" - Here, FF refers to Fill Factor, and it is a measure of the quality of a solar cell. The "64.36%" is the value of the FF.

Therefore, the "Property Value" entities in the paragraph are:

* PCE of 9.93%
* V oc of 0.92 V
* J sc of 16.77 mA cm^-2
* FF of 64.36%
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

* 9.93% (PCE)
* 0.92 V (Voc)
* 16.77 mA cm^-2 (Jsc)
* 64.36% (FF)

These are the entities that clearly refer to the Value of Material Properties in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.
